page.title: 01A Description of St.Ouen
page.content: St.Ouen is well known for its coastline and its potato farming. The main tourist attractions are Plemont Candle crafts, Pontins, Grosnez Castle, the race course and the bunkers on Les Landes. Les Landes is mostly made up of gorse and heather with towering cliffs bordering it. Les Landes was turned into a German strong point during the second world war, and also contains a disused rifle range. Grosnez Castle is on the most westerly point of the island and is in ruins. Further down the cliff is Grosnez Lighthouse. From here you can see the islands of Guernsey, Herm, Sark and on a clear day you can see Alderney and the coast of France.
